nodes.text: Iktotchi were a horned sentient species from the moon Iktotch. Jedi Master Saesee Tiin, a member of the Jedi High Council prior to and during the Clone Wars, was an Iktotchi.

The Iktotchi were a species of near-humans distinguished by the two large, curved horns protruding downwards from their heads. They had a skin-tone often varying from peach to brown, battering-ram foreheads with hardened, dense skin, and big, fleshy hands. Their natural habitat was rocky.
Saesee Tiin was an imposing Iktotchi who served as a Jedi Master and member of the Jedi High Council in the last decades of the Galactic Republic, and most notably the Clone Wars.

Dagio Belcoze operated as a computer engineer with Doctor Gubacher during the period of Galen Walton Erso's work with Project Celestial Power. Belcoze designed enhanced overseer droids, and entered into a drunken disagreement with Erso during a Republic Futures Program reunion at 500 Republica.

Ferren Barr was a Jedi padawan who survived Order 66 and became an advisor to Mon Calamari King Lee-Char. His notable feats include uncovering the details of the Great Jedi Purge and the truth of the Clone Wars, along with activating Order 66 on Purge Troopers to use them on the Inquisitors who were after him. He was ultimately killed by Darth Vader, but died knowing he played his part to assist the downfall of the Galactic Empire and the Sith.

During the Galactic Civil War, a two-faced Iktotchi served as security for a bar on Son-tuul; this individual had three eyes, two noses, and two mouths, and was shot by IG-90 during the assassin droid's search for Black Krrsantan.

Talvee Chawin was a crime lord on Coruscant's Level 1313 around the time of the Battle of Endor, and was known by his nickname of the Thorn—referring to his one remaining horn which curved under his chin with the appearance of a barbed, poisonous thorn.
Ax Tagrin was a bounty hunter active during the First Order/Resistance War who hunted and captured Resistance spies for the First Order.
